intro: Chrysothamnus graveolens var. glabratus, commonly known as the narrowleaf goldenbush, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and distinctive yellow blooms. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, such as rocky soils and open woodlands. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in dry conditions. The species is known for its aromatic foliage and is sometimes used in traditional herbal practices.
